reviews.text: With thinly spread plot and characters, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a nostalgia-choked highlight reel that‚Äôs for the fans and for the fans only.
reviews.author: Justin Kim

reviews.text: It's more or less what I was afraid it was going to be based on the trailers.
reviews.author: Vera Wylde

reviews.text: The thing about Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is that it tries to do far too much all at once, and ends up feeling utterly overstuffed.
reviews.author: Jack Martin

reviews.text: The weight of the film is largely carried by McKenna Grace's Phoebe, who chafes at being excluded from the specter battling shenanigans because of New York's strict paranormal child labor laws, or something.
reviews.author: Pete Vonder Haar

reviews.text: If this is the level of quality we can expect from Ghostbusters going forward, then maybe Walter Peck was right.
reviews.author: Calum Cooper

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire resorts to jingling keys in front of viewers‚Äô faces instead of honing its more vital elements. If this is what the Ghostbusters franchise, or any other franchise for that matter, has to do to stay relevant, then good riddance.
reviews.author: James Preston Poole

reviews.text: I didn‚Äôt hate ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù like apparently many others did. I liked it. I just wish there was more thinking outside of the box.
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: When it comes to straight-up storytelling, ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù lacks anything substantial or original, resulting in a film that, despite a few moments of fun, ultimately leaves audiences a bit cold.
reviews.author: Dana Barbuto

reviews.text: After the success of Ghostbusters: Afterlife, Sony brings the old gang back together, but the film struggles to justify their inclusion as it makes the new characters fail to impress.
reviews.author: Nelson Acosta

reviews.text: Frozen Empire proves that Ghostbusters doesn‚Äôt need to cling onto dated and toxic nostalgia. It has everything it needs right here.
reviews.author: Joonatan Itkonen

reviews.text: The tedious Afterlife was so distracted with not offending sensitive fanboy man-boys that it even bungled its throwbacks to the 1984 original. This one at least does OK with its nostalgic chants, provided one can ignore Bill Murray‚Äôs bored expressions.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: It‚Äôs forgettable, and some of the worst of what franchise filmmaking has to offer in 2024.
reviews.author: Alan French

reviews.text: Ultimately, "Frozen Empire" is fine. It‚Äôs not going to blow your house down or ruin your day, which is perfectly acceptable for a movie. But a "Ghostbusters" movie is never truly bad, it‚Äôs just a matter of understanding what it seeks to do ... .
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire may cut down on the nostalgia overload that the previous entry suffered from, but it's still plagued with a lazily-written storyline that doesn't explore its characters nearly enough.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: Offers frosty fun but lacks narrative cohesion. Enjoyable for fans, but not a standout in the supernatural fantasy genre.
reviews.author: Jason Escamilla

reviews.text: It's just so frustrating to see the shape of something that could fully work as a 21st century spin on Ghostbusters, but watch it whittle down to the dullest version of itself.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: As a review, this film is fun and family-friendly with nothing glaring on the good or bad side.
reviews.author: Derek Sante

reviews.text: The action scenes are the least interesting parts of the film, and, as the action increases, the film becomes increasingly uninspired.
reviews.author: Tim Miller

reviews.text: With each movie that‚Äôs churned out, it‚Äôs becoming more and more obvious that there‚Äôs only so much you can do with this world.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: For long-time series fans, Frozen Empire provides two more hours of Ghostbusters content.
reviews.author: Victor Stiff

reviews.text: Considering the talent on hand and the eternal goodwill of the original film, it's hard not to deem Afterlife another missed opportunity for the franchise.
reviews.author: John Serba

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire has many aspects that sound good on paper but don't work in execution.
reviews.author: Michelle Kisner

reviews.text: Although rich with potential, the film is a mishmash of fan service, underdeveloped characters, and underwhelming humour.
reviews.author: Neil Soans

reviews.text: Ghostbusters was a huge movie for many people and brought a lot of joy with every repeated viewing. It was fun, fresh, quotable, and a joy to watch. This is none of those things.
reviews.author: Paul Salfen

reviews.text: ...the picture begins its slow-but-steady descent into irrelevance as it progresses into a meandering and distressingly uninvolving midsection...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: What remains is a film that does many things well, but does not find a necessary balance.  [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: While Frozen Empire raises spirits and smiles, it even falls below the far-from-perfect Afterlife .
reviews.author: Ian Bunting

reviews.text: [Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire] is caught between nostalgic fan service and a new-generation family adventure. It tries to be both by having too many characters and too much story, little of it thrilling, parts of it passably entertaining.
reviews.author: Whang Yee Ling

reviews.text: Here‚Äôs hoping that if we are afflicted with another Ghostbusters film, it gives us something to really be scared of.
reviews.author: MontiLee Stormer

reviews.text: Fans will have some fun, but there are too many subplots for this story to thrive as intended. It spreads itself so thin, and the lack of focus is distracting.
reviews.author: Austin Burke

reviews.text: I'm at a point where I'm completely apathetic with this franchise.
reviews.author: JD Duran

reviews.text: Frozen Empire will satisfy fans who want to see the gang back, but as a film this is a corporately-minded muddle that may gross at the box office but lacks the heart of its predecessors.
reviews.author: Victoria Luxford

reviews.text: Busting makes me feel good. At the end of the day, it‚Äôs Ghostbusters, whaddaya want?
reviews.author: Jonathan Sim

reviews.text: While the film does have too many characters and subplots, I had a ton of fun spending time with these characters at the firehouse.
reviews.author: Sean Chandler

reviews.text: After so many mishandled or abandoned series ‚Äî from ‚ÄúFantastic Beasts‚Äù to ‚ÄúNarnia‚Äù to ‚ÄúPercy Jackson‚Äù ‚Äî it‚Äôs nice to see one that‚Äôs heading in the right direction.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: While there are several promising action set pieces and a collection of genuine creepy poltergeists, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire disappointingly fumbles the landing due to an oversized cast and a reluctance to move away from the franchises‚Äô past.
reviews.author: Nicola Austin

reviews.text: When all is said and done, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire stumbles under the weight of expectations. While it is such a joy to see some of these characters reunite, the film struggles to keep the new story moving forward.
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: While the ghostbusting of the Spengler family is great entertainment, when the Garraka appears, the film becomes serious, with fear-provoking scenes taking on a horror-film tone.
reviews.author: Sarah Knight Adamson

reviews.text: A little slow in parts but the combination of the old with the new is a winner.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: I don't think we need any more of this. I think that's enough 'Ghostbusters.'
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.text: All the ideas that they were presenting I think were good ideas; just give them time to breathe.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: A boring rehash of familiar beats for nostalgia's sake.
reviews.author: Josh Korngut

reviews.text: I thought it was really boring. I wasn't invested in any of the characters and by the end I was like 'does everybody get to be a ghostbuster?'
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: We get some rather uninspired CGI, a villain that reeks of Guillermo del Toro envy and a bored looking Bill Murray phoning it in. Thanks, but no thanks for the memories.
reviews.author: Rub√©n Rosario

reviews.text: Alas, despite the wobbly plot, I had a great time with this film. Lot's of subtle humor, even in the reactions shots. Listen and watch carefully.üëª
reviews.author: Ross Anthony

reviews.text: A convoluted but reasonably fun and entertaining sequel.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: While things do play in fast forward sometimes, almost as if it‚Äôs in a crunch to be everything to everyone, Frozen Empire does get the basics right and its own evolution more so. It‚Äôs a give-and-take kind of flick, enjoyable to the last.
reviews.author: Bill Arceneaux

reviews.text: ... creaky and overstuffed. Full of references to the 1984 original, it has a plot that‚Äôs more complicated that it needs to be, jarring errors in continuity and logic, and characters with little to do.
reviews.author: Valerie Kalfrin

reviews.text: Until Ghostbusters decides if it wants to throw its lot in with one era or the other, it‚Äôs always going to be between two worlds. And that purgatory makes for a middling experience that doesn‚Äôt quite satisfy.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: This sequel looks to be seriously under baked, which is not surprising given its relatively short development time, plus the damaging effects of the pandemic and the writer's strike in Hollywood.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: This newest franchise entry is built on nostalgia and a stacked cast, but not enough to make it worth watching.
reviews.author: Jack Riedy

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire falls short of its predecessor, but the members of the classic and new cast inject enough energy, charm, and emotion to compensate for the narrative inconsistencies and pacing issues.
reviews.author: Manuel S√£o Bento

reviews.text: I did like the ensemble -- it seemed like they were having a great time.
reviews.author: Tony Baker

reviews.text: There so much potential for this Ghostbusters as a franchise to take off into different and new territory. Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a step in the right direction that leaves us waiting for a leap in that same direction.
reviews.author: Omar Holmon

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a bit of a mixed bag. While it does offer some fun and enjoyable moments there are issues that keep it from reaching its full potential.
reviews.author: Jake Peffer

reviews.text: If you thought the 2021 feature was dull and full of cheap nostalgia dumps, hold on to your hats because this one is far worse.
reviews.author: Hector A. Gonzalez

reviews.text: An enjoyable sci-fi-comedy romp. It doesn‚Äôt top the 1984 original (what could?), but it entertains. The new cast embraces the spooky thrills and the old guard gets moments to shine. Yes, there's shameless fan pandering, but who you gonna call?
reviews.author: Niall Browne

reviews.text: To quote the Ghostbusters theme song, "I ain't afraid of no ghosts!" ... but when the main action and resolution are crammed into the last quarter of the film, it will leave you feeling like maybe you wanted to be a little afraid.
reviews.author: Candice McMillan

reviews.text: I‚Äôve some respect for films that sacrifice character work for plot development -- moviemaking is a balancing act, after all -- but in this case, the story is clumsy and the payoff, underwhelming.
reviews.author: Jorge Ignacio Castillo

reviews.text: I feel like a grumpy old Gen X'er, but enough already. If you're still going to stoop to gratuitous cameos then at least give me a story to nail them to -- and some fresh ideas to colour it in.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Kenan and co. aimed for something different, a risk which should be commended, but it didn‚Äôt entirely work leaving Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire as a fun but highly flawed effort.
reviews.author: Matt Hudson

reviews.text: The investments are too large to risk someone choking on nuance, after all.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: Bustin' makes me feel nothing.
reviews.author: Adam Olinger

reviews.text: It's Grace who stands out as the emotional centre of the film, and while the subsequent tugging of heartstrings may not be to every viewer's liking, it never overwhelms the default setting of gag after gag after gag.
reviews.author: Terry Staunton

reviews.text: Some will be drawn to its heavy nostalgia; other to its playful spirit and fun visual effects. But those things alone can‚Äôt save ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù from its overstuffed story, too many characters, and its overall lack of anything original.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: Frozen Empire is a step in the right direction, but it‚Äôs still too reliant on the glories of the past.
reviews.author: Tom Beasley

reviews.text: The transition from a comedy to a more world-building fantasy for a new generation was working with Afterlife because there was still a healthy share of laughs. That is subdued now with a lot of story and an overstuffed cast.
reviews.author: Erik Childress

reviews.text: It's like the scriptwriters just devoured some plates of Ghostbusters' stuff and went barf... none of it makes any sense.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: This movie is overstuffed with too many characters and subplots...They were trying to do too much at one time and it made the film feel stilted, slow, and plodding.
reviews.author: Michael Cook

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a disjointed mess, bloated with too many scattered storylines.
reviews.author: Susan Kamyab

reviews.text: There's still fun to be had with the Ghostbusters world, but Frozen Empire crumbles under the amount of characters and plot lines it's trying to juggle. There's some good ideas and a few bad ones but they're all equally undercooked.
reviews.author: Cody Leach

reviews.text: Bill Murray was right: Ghostbusters should‚Äôve never been sequelized.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: There is just enough emotional pull there to stop the Ghostbusters empire from crumbling.
reviews.author: Dulcie Pearce

reviews.text: Frozen Empire gets lost in a clumsy script, an excess of characters and a swamp of nostalgia. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro Alem√°n

reviews.text: As far as Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire goes, it is exciting‚Ä¶ enough and is carried by the fun cast and design work.
reviews.author: Bradley Gibson

reviews.text: It‚Äôs not very funny, frightening, exciting or ambitious, and visually flat... There is something kindly and well-meant in its script and performances, though, a lack of cynicism starting with the cast, which makes it amiably involving.
reviews.author: Nick Hasted

reviews.text: The cast is strong enough to keep us smiling, but the movie is neither funny nor scary enough to be much more than a bit of over-egged fluff.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Rudd and Aykroyd bring the energy, but Mckenna Grace‚Äôs Phoebe gives the sequel a heartbeat. The focus shifts back to the comedy aspect of the original, which is great.  However, there are too many subplots and players on the field.
reviews.author: Joe Friar

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire clones the style of the Reitmans' stock, lets the actors speak, and prefers not to polish most of the comic situations by trusting everything to the charisma of its stars... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fausto Fernandez

reviews.text: Most of you reading this aren‚Äôt going to dissect the minutiae of the filmmaking, lore, or legacy. You‚Äôre just looking for a pleasant way to spend a few hours that won‚Äôt actively insult your intelligence. As blockbusters go, you could do a lot worse.
reviews.author: Tim Brennan

reviews.text: As far as strained continuations go, this one could have been worse. If you put aside any attachment to the original classic, this one comes close to working as a well-produced popcorn escape.
reviews.author: Alci Rengifo

reviews.text: Frozen Empire is a perfectly serviceable slice of bright and breezy low-intensity horror.
reviews.author: Paul Mount

reviews.text: For the moment, there is much more action in this film than in the previous one. And to instill nostalgia, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire includes appearances from old acquaintances... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: The Ghostbusters franchise obviously isn‚Äôt ready to let go of the past.
reviews.author: Mark Meszoros

reviews.text: We might as well let AI make the soulless nostalgia fare at this point; you'd get roughly the same result as 'Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire,' and that $100 million budget could have been spent on movies worth spending it on.
reviews.author: Charlotte Simmons

reviews.text: The plot is pretty much a cut-and-paste duplication of the original film.
reviews.author: Wendy Ide

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire tries to carry the baton of the franchise but it spectacularly drops it, with its lack of humour or originality leaving the Ghostbusters ‚Äì and its foreseeable future ‚Äì on thin ice.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: Ghostbusters Part 1 concludes with an epic battle against a giant marshmallow kaiju, Part 2 sees the Statue of Liberty spring to life, and now Frozen Empire wraps up anticlimactically in a garage... Felt like a Disney+ adaptation of the classic IP.
reviews.author: John Flickinger

reviews.text: Doesn‚Äôt take itself too seriously and is simply trying to have fun along with its audience. Not everything lands, but there are worse ways to spend a couple of hours.
reviews.author: Michael Ward

reviews.text: Ghostbusters - Frozen Empire is a dull, forgettable piece of work that goes to show that some ghosts need to be put to rest.
reviews.author: Harris Dang

reviews.text: "Ghostbusters: Ghost Apocalypse" wants to be many things at once and is none of them. Nor is it funny, terrifying, exciting or touching [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Aglaia Berlutti

reviews.text: This is a prime example of a film being good enough without coming anywhere near great.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: Despite an intriguing subplot for Phoebe, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is an incohesive, unoriginal entry. It coasts on fan service to carry a paper-thin plot and a lukewarm crop of characters, new and old.
reviews.author: Lauren Coates

reviews.text: The gatekeepers of this franchise seem to have no idea what makes GHOSTBUSTERS ... spirit surprises and comedy ... not constant special effects, complex stories, snail pacing and a cast that could fill Grand Central Station. Somebody haunt Bill Murray!
reviews.author: Patrick McDonald

reviews.text: It works best when it apes the grounded tone and smart assery of the original, but the writing isn‚Äôt anywhere near as sharp as the 1984 film.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire does have its redeeming factor as an entertaining Ghostbusters movie, but it really could have benefitted from more time fleshing out the newer characters. The experience is still somewhat satisfying, but it feels overstuffed.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Harris

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire emerges as a fun sequel but is burdened by juggling too many ideas.
reviews.author: Kit Stone

reviews.text: Overstuffed yet supernaturally charming... a miniseries of fresh concepts (shoehorned) into a feature film locked in at a mere two hours... (the ads) never give away the most meaningful subplot...
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: A few of the apparitions will look familiar, too, in what might be called a reunion of kindred spirits.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: As scattershot and uneven as it is unnecessary, it fails to effectively build on the foundation laid in Afterlife while at the same time relegating the ‚Äúold timers‚Äù into oddly-integrated super-cameo appearances.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: As much as I liked the cast, this movie lacked the character connections that were created in Afterlife.
reviews.author: Wendy Lee Szany

reviews.text: There are definitely moments of enjoyment and hints at what could have been ‚Äî but by falling into the trap of trying to do too much, the movie ends up doing not enough.
reviews.author: Sarah Gopaul

reviews.text: There's a lot of self-referential backslapping throughout the film, but overall the problem is that there's too much going on. It's like the filmmakers couldn't figure out what story to tell, so they just threw everything into the mix.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: It‚Äôs passable entertainment that struggles between nostalgia and adjusting the series canon.
reviews.author: Kevin Carr

reviews.text: Beneath the effects-driven mayhem, this latest sequel is more about recycling and recombining old ideas.
reviews.author: Todd Jorgenson

reviews.text: A no-Gozer...
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: The 1984 original was original and entertaining. This fifth instalment is not the former and barely the latter. The Ghostbusters song asks "Who ya gonna call?" My suggestion is call it quits, but I suspect there's a ghost of a chance of that happening.
reviews.author: Stephen Romei

reviews.text: Judging by this edition, there seems little need for another Ghostbusters. Passing proton packs from generation to generation has its limits.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: The original stars are utilized to a greater extent than they were in Ghostbusters: Afterlife, especially Dan Aykroyd, who gives a touching performance as Ray.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù may not make a profound impact, but if you are a fan of the franchise, it will certainly make you feel good.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: The result of this ever-growing pastiche of characters is that nobody gets the amount of attention they need, leaving it uncertain what Frozen Empire is trying to achieve.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: ‚ÄúGhostbusters: Frozen Empire‚Äù reassembles most of the original cast along with the cast of ‚ÄúAfterlife‚Äù in a craven ‚Äújust play the hits‚Äù Ghostbusters retread that lacks any of the joy or originality that made the original film so beloved.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: If only the filmmakers could‚Äôve shoehorned some actual jokes into this overstuffed confection, or served up action that didn‚Äôt look like it was edited in a digital shredder!
reviews.author: Glenn Kenny

reviews.text: While this, the fifth installment of the strange in the neighborhood franchise, may not be the strongest, it's still spooktacular fun. Ultimately, bustin' makes us feel good.
reviews.author: Lisa Johnson Mandell

reviews.text: It‚Äôs apparently not enough for Frozen Empire to simply follow our new Ghostbusters on an adventure‚Äîwe must make many, many, many stops off at Fan Service Central... continually clobbering any forward momentum this thing has right in the crotch.
reviews.author: Jason Adams

reviews.text: While not great, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, is still quite good and entertaining enough.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: Never mind her billing; as in AFTERLIFE, [McKenna] Grace is the real star of FROZEN EMPIRE and...gives the movie an emotional anchor in the midst of all the spectacle and narrative chaos.
reviews.author: Michael Gingold

reviews.text: Anyone haunted, nay, scared witless by Hollywood‚Äôs risk averse dependence on sequels, franchises and spin-offs will turn white at this latest soulless manifestation of the once proud Ghostbusters.
reviews.author: Alan Corr

reviews.text: The end result is entertaining, with a full-tilt opening and a strong finale, bolstered by some good performances -- Rudd is on his best likeably goofy form -- but it sags in the middle.
reviews.author: Freda Cooper

reviews.text: [The problems] are threefold. Firstly, it adds nothing new to a flimsy formula, and neglects newer characters; secondly, it is paced as urgently as a snail‚Äôs funeral; and thirdly, its ancient villain is so unsatisfying I felt like booing it.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: I‚Äôm trying to be charitable here, because if I‚Äôm being honest -- despite understanding the business case for them -- I‚Äôm baffled by the existence of reverent, unfunny Ghostbusters movies.
reviews.author: Jesse Hassenger

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire returns the franchise back to its rightful Manhattan home. The result is a moderately fun action adventure that weaponizes nostalgia.
reviews.author: Drew Tinnin

reviews.text: Add it all together, and Frozen Empire is a film that does justice to neither the past nor the present.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: If one is being blunt, the only reason for it to exist aside from those delightful miniature Stay-Puft marshmallow imps, is the delightful discovery that Kumail Nanjiani may very well be the cinematic heir of Bill Murray.
reviews.author: Andrea Chase

reviews.text: The latest attempt to turn Ghostbusters into a legitimate franchise is basically your worst coworker. It‚Äôs lazy, stupid, and does everything it can to look busy while not actually doing much of anything.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: It's been a long time between buckets of popcorn, but it feels like Ghostbusters is back in safe hands.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Frozen Empire isn‚Äôt nearly as glacial or tepid as Afterlife, but it does suffer from a similar desire to drown us in Easter eggs.
reviews.author: Bilge Ebiri

reviews.text: The Achilles heel of Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is in its very essence: It wants to cover so much (adding new and old characters to the story) but does not fully develop the multiple protagonists who come to life in the plot [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Bond

reviews.text: There are just too many characters, old and new. Even the poster is overloaded. It feels long, with action and special effects that are not so special.
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: Is Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire a serviceable entry in the franchise? Sure, but they... because water down the characters and story for the sake of special effects, which means Ghostbusters has become a clich√© of itself.
reviews.author: M.N. Miller

reviews.text: This busting will not make you feel good.
reviews.author: Rick Bentley

reviews.text: Ghoulish reboot sequel has lots going on; language, scares.
reviews.author: Tara McNamara

reviews.text: The Spenglers have moved to New York City and before you can say ‚ÄúBack off, man. I‚Äôm a scientist,‚Äù they‚Äôre up to the ECTO-1‚Äôs wheel wells in paranormal terrors.
reviews.author: Rick Romancito

reviews.text: ... a recycled narrative that brings the gang back together but without a discernable purpose.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: On the whole the movie, directed by Gil Kenan from a script by Kenan and Jason Reitman, is an enjoyable lavish no-brainer.
reviews.author: M.V. Moorhead

reviews.text: While there are enjoyable moments & fun camaraderie between the old + new Ghostbusters, Frozen Empire barely has any of the spark of the original to justify its existence.
reviews.author: Ruth Maramis

reviews.text: This film will not for a moment let us forget how important its progenitor was.
reviews.author: Sean Collier

reviews.text: Much better than the wobbly reboot, with plenty to delight both long-time fans and newcomers.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: Counting one character's otherworldly powers, there are TWELVE GHOSTBUSTERS fighting in the final battle. The insane amount of narrative incidents could tip into incoherence. But director / co-writer Gil Kenan corrals it for a fun, somewhat bumpy sequel.
reviews.author: Nick Rogers

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire has its flaws, but Sony shouldn't put the franchise on ice just yet.
reviews.author: Martin Shore

reviews.text: It‚Äôs far too much narrative, all crammed into a franchise that‚Äôs also relying on a lot of fan service as dialogue, gags, and more from previous outings are woven into the film to elicit easy laughs, hoots, and hollers.
reviews.author: Jeff York

reviews.text: it‚Äôs so overstuffed ... we lose sight of the best part of Afterlife, which was the family dynamic between Callie and her kids and the delightfully named Gary Grooberson.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: The reverence for the past here does nobody any favours. It is as if a 1984 kids‚Äô film tried to get them interested in the collected lore and backstory of Abbott and Costello.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: Frozen Empire turns its lemons into lemonade with novel character arcs ‚Äî which, coincidentally, help distract from the fact that there are no ideas left to mine in the Ghostbusters franchise.
reviews.author: Jackson Weaver

reviews.text: I really enjoyed some parts of Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, but I'm disappointed again. Nostalgia is what is sidetracking any good ideas that are going on.
reviews.author: Korey Coleman

reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned, it's time to put the long-running franchise to bed.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Despite the amazing talent on and off camera, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a soulless film because it is a business decision first, and a work of art second.
reviews.author: Ryan Oquiza

reviews.text: Sadly, the more it expands the less I care, and although Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is not the lowest point, it feels like the least creative of the series.
reviews.author: Leo Brady

reviews.text: With Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, busting still makes me feel good.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: Admittedly, we‚Äôve pretty much seen it all before, but it‚Äôs still good fun.
reviews.author: Russ Simmons

reviews.text: Perhaps it‚Äôs time to put this franchise on ice.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: Bustin‚Äô no longer makes me feel good.
reviews.author: Dan Scully

reviews.text: This beloved series continues down an unfulfilling and humor-deprived family adventure path and none of the new characters will be as adored 40 years from now as Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston remain 40 years after the original.
reviews.author: Mark Keizer

reviews.text: In its favor, Frozen Empire scales way back on reverence for Ghostbuster minutia and lore...On the other hand, [it's] overly busy, flatly-lit, and plasticky-looking, with...little feel for action sequences, creature design, pacing, or building suspense
reviews.author: Andrew Dignan

reviews.text: A blunt Gen X nostalgia play -- a tribute act grinding out the oldies on a cruise ship to nowhere.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: Gil Kenan doesn't so much shepherd a story as he does manage the "Ghostbusters" brand for 115 minutes. We get a few winks, a few ghosts, and that's about it.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: The real problem with Frozen Empire is that there is no pressing reason for the film to exist.
reviews.author: Grant Watson

reviews.text: Aykroyd, who co-wrote the summer of 1984 blockbuster with the late Harold Ramis, is the heart and soul of a film that sets new against old.
reviews.author: Brad Wheeler

reviews.text: My fingers have taken to their death bed simply typing out the basics. Yet, ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù is an eclectic, enjoyable barrage of nonsense ‚Äî a circus act that kicks off with a Robert Frost poem and climaxes with Ray Parker Jr.‚Äôs titular synth banger.
reviews.author: Amy Nicholson

reviews.text: Its excessive focus on the past, rather than looking toward the future, seriously hurts an unnecessary film. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro G. Calvo

reviews.text: As a Ghostbusters movie, this is worse than anything that has come before it: a befuddled, chaotic... downright incoherent assortment of only loosely connected scenes and gags crashing into each other and desperately hoping for laughs and chills.
reviews.author: Andrew Parker

reviews.text: It‚Äôs all too much of nothing special and all too little of anything funny or fun.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: Aykroyd and Grace are the soul of the thing, to whatever degree a soul exists. At this point, Aykroyd has shed any pretence of ironic distance, emerging as the mournful weirdo he surely always was.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: The fun of the known makes up for lack of originality... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Paula V√°zquez Prieto

reviews.text: Seeing the OG Ghostbusters team strapping on their proton packs was a hoot, but this latest installment in the franchise made some odd plot choices.
reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

reviews.text: Other than Aykroyd, who admittedly displays a characteristic glee at being in his comfort zone here, nobody seems to want to be there or going through these motions again.
reviews.author: David Fear

reviews.text: A very busy movie that lacks the emotional hook of its predecessor, while spending too much time on the wrong characters in a way that yields a rather lifeless, chilly affair.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: A significant upgrade from ‚ÄúAfterlife,‚Äù which relocated the action to Oklahoma and forgot to pack any comedy. "Frozen Empire,‚Äù back, thankfully, in New York, is a breezier, more serviceable sequel that has a modest charm as an ‚Äô80-tinged family adventure.
reviews.author: Jake Coyle

reviews.text: An agreeable franchise entry.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: The humor still falls flat, the action is still uninteresting, and the mythos remain as formless and plain as it‚Äôs always been.
reviews.author: Nick Johnston

reviews.text: Grace captures the confusions of being 15 and out of sorts, and she provides more than enough of an emotional through line to pull the film together, especially when complimented by the eternally charming Rudd.
reviews.author: Richard Whittaker

reviews.text: Sometime around the eighth or ninth round of expository mumbo jumbo concerning the ectoplasmic nightmare about to happen, the movie starts moving sideways, not forward. Hate to say it, but: hold that ghost, indeed.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: It's tough to balance the casual vibe required for comedy to work with the effortfulness of huge special effects, but "Frozen Empire" pulls it off.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: The new film is professionally made, well-acted, entertaining enough, and possessed of no earthly reason to exist aside from the care and feeding of intellectual property.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: If you are a ‚ÄúGhostbusters‚Äù completist, you‚Äôll want to see this, and it‚Äôs just competent enough that you won‚Äôt feel that your time was entirely wasted.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: It‚Äôs a franchise reduced to nothing more than a parade of hollow, familiar images, lightly repackaged in hopes that we‚Äôll buy another ticket and try to revisit the emotions we felt when we encountered this world for the first time
reviews.author: Austen Goslin

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is busting at the seams, and not just with ghosts. A jumble of old and new characters, mythology and fan service, it‚Äôs overstuffed and yet feels like something is missing.
reviews.author: Richard Crouse

reviews.text: I thought it was alright, but it definitely suffered from nostalgia overload. In my opinion, the new cast and old cast didn't mesh as well as they did in the previous one and lacks the emotional depth and heart of the prior movie.
reviews.author: Elliott Collins

reviews.text: A family horror comedy that is neither scary nor funny. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Philipp Engel

reviews.text: Frozen Empire is an effective, nice, enjoyable, and harmless new chapter in the series that, however, falls short when it comes to resolving the expectations that it creates... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Loser

reviews.text: Grace is by far the best here, showing the same kind of twitchy emotional energy that first got Kristen Stewart noticed; her and Lind‚Äôs interplay is the only remotely blithe spirit on show.
reviews.author: Jonathan Romney

reviews.text: Lay this series to rest in a proton pack, please!
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: This franchise really belongs in the rearview mirror.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: perfectly fine but incredibly dull
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Fun, but fails to capture the magic of the originals. A mixed bag for Ghostbusters fans.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: The plot is filled with elaborate twists, excessive exposition and unnecessary drama between characters, feeling more like a way to fill time than telling a real story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Rivera Rubio

reviews.text: Crammed with characters familiar and new, overstuffed with clunky CGI and hysterical action but distressingly short of laughs, ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù is less cool than moldy.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire simply cannot let go of the past, making us wonder what the point of the franchise's present is and if it actually deserves a future.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: ‚ÄúGhostbusters: Frozen Empire‚Äù delivers a fun, action-packed adventure in the world of ghostbusting. With family at its core, this movie is a perfect blockbuster film that pays homage to the franchise while also appealing to newcomers.
reviews.author: Rosa Parra

reviews.text: There is enough here - probably - to placate the hardcore fans, even if it's clear that the filmmakers aren't looking to re-invent the wheel...in fact, they're so content with the wheel that they're passing up opportunities to really fly.
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: There's more to like here than in the last film, but this is still undoubtedly a franchise that's living in the past
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: Between laughs, nostalgic moments and the one-two punch of jump scares and intense ghost encounters, there‚Äôs a nice pace of action and comedy from the beginning. We‚Äôre reminded of what originally made this franchise fun.
reviews.author: John Kirk

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is too much fun to skip and watching these Ghostbusters makes me feel good.
reviews.author: Tania Lamb

reviews.text: Gil Kenan isn‚Äôt above leaning on the familiar, but he certainly tries to let this supernatural actioner find its own identity too, with the results being a mixed bag of potential unrealised
reviews.author: Peter Gray

reviews.text: A silly and confusing nostalgia-infused stew that suffers from ingredients well past their sell-by dates, ‚ÄúGhostbusters: Frozen Empire‚Äù is an erratic mess of plot and pacing, with too many layers and too many characters.
reviews.author: Lynn Venhaus

reviews.text: Not as good as the previous installment, but fun enough to entertain both longtime and new fans alike. McKenna Grace and Dan Aykroyd shine the most, while the mythology and design of the new big baddie are pretty cool. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: I hate to say it, but bustin' just doesn't make me feel good anymore.
reviews.author: Matt Donato

reviews.text: While at times messy and overstuffed with characters, the exploration of new Ghostbusters lore and charming cast made this still rather enjoyable.
reviews.author: Cris Parker

reviews.text: As fun as it is nonsensical, there's enough charm to make this installment enjoyable.
reviews.author: Joseph Robinson

reviews.text: A lackluster, overproduced, and forgettable entry in the Ghostbusters franchise.
reviews.author: Avi Offer

reviews.text: "It‚Äôs like one lick of a big soft-serve ice cream cone with your second favorite flavor. You know what it tastes like, it is tasty, but it leaves you wanting more and preferably, with your very favorite flavor."
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: The movie has too many characters and too few new ideas, and it‚Äôs more concerned with cramming mass appeal into the picture than telling a good story.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: ‚Ä¶ artless, soulless, joyless concoction of corporate vapidity.
reviews.author: Anthony O'Connor

reviews.text: This ‚Äòbusters made me feel okay.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: [Aykroyd] practically glows. It's enough to make you want to see the actor make "Ghostbusters" movies forever ‚Äî so long as they're better than "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire."
reviews.author: Odie Henderson

reviews.text: Despite its weaknesses, this sequel is well above the poorly stretched bubblegum of Ghostbusters 2 and the overdose of nostalgia of Ghostbusters Afterlife. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Juanma Fern√°ndez Par√≠s

reviews.text:
With nostalgic warmth and a jolt of laughter, Frozen Empire saves us from the emotional hypothermia that other blockbusters can cause.
[Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Nestor Bentancor

reviews.text: Although it is not a complete failure, there is something infuriating in the producers' obsession with continuing to squeeze out a franchise that clearly has run out of artistic juice. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: When the spark goes out and the humor doesn‚Äôt garner laughs anymore, it‚Äôs time to consider putting this one in the grave.
reviews.author: Maggie Lovitt

reviews.text: Despite some inconsistencies and conveniences as compared to its predecessor, it is still a fun offering with a strong core. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Laia Cabuli

reviews.text: There‚Äôs too many characters, too many arcs, and not enough development. The main cast is underutilized, while the veteran Ghostbusters make glorified cameos that don‚Äôt add to the story. {...} This was a disappointing turn in the Ghostbusters franchise.
reviews.author: Kristen Maldonado

reviews.text: ... Losing momentum as it goes, Frozen Empire raises the increasingly frustrating suspicion that Kenan and Reitman couldn't choose which of their various story ideas to use, and so decided to use them all.
reviews.author: Nicholas Barber

reviews.text: It‚Äôs so confused by its own lore, by its incessant callbacks to the past and by its uncertainty around how to address the present that it mostly unfolds as a series of loosely connected ‚ÄúGhostbusters-themed‚Äù sequences rather than an actual coherent movie.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: [Gil] Kenan and [Jason] Reitman have a better sense of incorporating our favorite legacy characters and the new cast while retaining that classic Ghostbusters feeling.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: It‚Äôs still somewhat amusing to see the old cast yet again (perhaps more so for anyone who has forgotten the previous film, which did the exact same thing).
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: This is another cluttered sequel that lets down the aspects that are working, consistently freezing itself in its tracks
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: Amusing sequel spits out Easter eggs between modest comic morsels.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: Despite some pacing troubles and a few characters deserving a little more screen time, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is an excellent entry in a storied franchise.
reviews.author: Jason Flatt

reviews.text: Frozen Empire is arguably ‚Äújust‚Äù a sequel to Ghostbusters, but that in itself is an achievement because, in a way, we‚Äôve never actually had one before.
reviews.author: Luke Y. Thompson

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire has strong family dynamics with Mckenna Grace being the standout, but a sluggish pace and weak story overshadow the charm. The underwhelming villain also takes too long to show up making this a forgettable experience.
reviews.author: Shahbaz Siddiqui

reviews.text: How do you service the past while not packing so much into the future that each element drowns out the others? This is a tricky balance to strike, and Frozen Empire isn‚Äôt able to manage it.
reviews.author: Murjani Rawls

reviews.text: Exhibiting a tone and setting being closer to the late Ivan Reitman‚Äôs classic franchise starter, [Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire] isn‚Äôt merely a nostalgic throwback, it‚Äôs a rekindling of a legend.
reviews.author: Mike Reyes

reviews.text: Overall, I enjoyed it. It was fun.
reviews.author: Emma Wolfe

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is simply a product of its time, a modern-day sequel chock full of references and nostalgia bait but with no clear vision as to where it's going, or why.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire makes for a serviceable entry in this now four-decade-running franchise.
reviews.author: Manuel Betancourt

reviews.text: For those who watch Frozen Empire not as an exercise in nostalgia, but as a proper film with its own character arcs and story beats, then Phoebe‚Äôs act of defiance offers the first suggestion Ghostbusters might actually mean something in the year 2024.
reviews.author: Joe George

reviews.text: Frozen Empire still has plenty of nostalgia for the 1984 movie. It's only about 50% nostalgic callbacks, which is better than Afterlife's 90%, but the new stuff isn't funny.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: There are more than enough ghouls, goo and goofy wisecracks to justify yet another movie, which should be recommendation enough.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: The best I can say about Ghostbusters, Frozen Empire is, it‚Äôs not the worst. That would be Ghostbusters: Afterlife.
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: Unfocused and overstuffed, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is proof that fan-service nostalgia and too many underdeveloped characters cannot make up for a shoddy story. Bill Murray has the worst jokes in the movie.
reviews.author: Carla Hay

reviews.text: The first Ghostbusters movie that feels obligatory, scattershot and devoid of any real soul.
reviews.author: Dan Murrell

reviews.text: An energetic, funny continuation of the franchise and the first that truly feels like it‚Äôs found the right groove.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is so focused on making sure that it hits every single bit of nostalgia possible that the new characters and the story get pushed aside until the last twenty minutes.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: There are protracted moments of humor, fright, and pathos in Frozen Empire, but as it‚Äôs all so scattershot and disconnected, the film ends up being defined by its lack of conviction when it comes to exploring its ideas to the fullest.
reviews.author: Justin Clark

reviews.text: This overcrowded mashup and its complicated, convoluted plot feels like a franchise that may have finally run out of ghostbusting gas.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: This sequel didn‚Äôt need to exist, but it‚Äôs working very hard to make you like it, and only the iciest of hearts won‚Äôt crack a smile at least once.
reviews.author: Ryan Britt

reviews.text: Kenan delivers a lively continuation with ‚ÄúFrozen Empire,‚Äù doing his best to maintain the needs of community members and the development of a major threat, showing some serious love for the series, personalities, and equipment in the process.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire chills and thrills in an ectoplasm-fueled sequel that's sure to delight audiences. Old and new school cast members return to familiar New York City haunts with big laughs and a surprisingly emotional storyline.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: With its blend of supernatural spectacle, engaging characters, and a touch of nostalgia, it's a worthy addition to the Ghostbusters legacy. So, grab your proton pack and prepare for a thrilling adventure that's sure to leave you frozen in awe.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: Like Slimer shoving snacks in his ravenous maw, ‚ÄúGhostbusters: Frozen Empire‚Äù tries to cram way too many characters, storylines and iconic images into its two-hour runtime.
reviews.author: Christy Lemire

reviews.text: Though the ensemble is too large, Frozen Empire does successfully find a decent balance between the multiple generations featured here, letting the younger cast drive most of the action without leaving the older characters on the sidelines.
reviews.author: Liz Shannon Miller

reviews.text: The tone is muddled, to be sure, but that is just the state of ‚Äúcomedy‚Äù on the big screen these days. Gone is the willingness to push the boundaries, as is the sense of in-universe intelligence.
reviews.author: Jay Ledbetter

reviews.text: Ever get the feeling you‚Äôve just been slimed with something other than ectoplasm?...Like so many of the post-content films crammed down our throats over the past 30+ years, [it] is not so much a film as an extended exercise in brand recognition.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: Frozen Empire offers familiar set pieces, callbacks, and references aplenty, but the nostalgia tank is now running on empty.
reviews.author: Meagan Navarro

reviews.text: The reliance on nostalgia weakens the plot, but the graphics and special effects help to reinforce the spectral oddities while the old and new casts blend well to create a loveable extended family.
reviews.author: Chris Joyce

reviews.text: It often favors tone and attitude over a propulsive story, which can drag things a bit, but that tone and attitude nail the indescribable feeling of a Ghostbusters movie...And busting makes us feel good, even when it‚Äôs messy.
reviews.author: Germain Lussier

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a joyous and inspired continuation of the Ghostbusters franchise. The cast additions and the inventive storytelling make Frozen Empire feel fresh and new.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: What it lacks in intelligence it makes up for with good vibes and great casting.
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: Everyone is here‚ÄîBill Murray, Dan Ackroyd, Paul Rudd, the list goes on‚Äîso it's less who you gonna call than why?
reviews.author: Emily Zemler

reviews.text: "Like Afterlife, Frozen Empire ultimately succeeds because it‚Äôs so much fun to watch"
reviews.author: Nick Levine

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire manages to outdo 2021‚Äôs Ghostbusters: Afterlife thanks to a stronger script with less reliance on callbacks to carry so much of the weight of the film.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire doubles down, fully committing to its existence as a cynical nostalgia raid masquerading as a movie.
reviews.author: Tara Bennett

reviews.text: About half way through things begin to click together a bit more but there's too many characters and too much set up and the movie isn't as funny as it could be.
reviews.author: Eric Goldman

reviews.text: Never mind a death chill, Frozen Empire feels more like the death rattle for the franchise. The sad truth is bustin‚Äô doesn‚Äôt really make us feel that good anymore.
reviews.author: Dallas King

reviews.text: Like many reboot sequels before it, reminds us why this franchise died when it did. Please put it back in the Containment Unit immediately.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: If you ever wondered what a live-action version of The Real Ghostbusters animated series might look like, Frozen Empire is the answer.
reviews.author: David Gonzalez

reviews.text: Nothing can ever live up to the original but Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is another solid outing for the franchise in bringing the scares and fun.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: ‚ÄúGhostbusters: Frozen Empire‚Äù is messy, visually unappealing, and worst of all, unfunny, and is further evidence that major studios too often rely on brand recognition to make them money rather than putting together a film worth audiences‚Äô time.
reviews.author: Cody Dericks

reviews.text: Overall, Frozen Empire banks on the nostalgic fan-service a little too much. What is the point of creating a new legacy of heroes when everyone is still stuck in the past?
reviews.author: Laura Sirikul

reviews.text: Even more so than Jason Reitman‚Äôs ‚ÄúGhostbusters: Afterlife,‚Äù this latest breezier iteration of the ‚ÄòGhostbusters‚Äô franchise leans into the series‚Äô peculiar weird and quirky corners with unhurried patience.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: Frozen Empire is a notable improvement on Afterlife ‚Äì funny, silly, and a little scary, with its pockets full of hand-built doodahs and the occasional excursion into the realm of pseudo-mythology and parapsychology.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: Although ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù improves upon the previous film and there's plenty to dig especially for young fans, it falls short of the 1984 classic's high bar.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: The Ghostbusters franchise continues to be one of the worst offenders of peddling cheap and easy nostalgia for laughs and poignancy.
reviews.author: Lucas Hill-Paul

reviews.text: ...Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is hardly worth hating; it‚Äôs a lightweight, amiable, will-this-do? fantasy‚Ä¶content to recycle dialogue, musical, special effects and situations from the first film rather than figure out what made it work in the first place.
reviews.author: Eddie Harrison

reviews.text: The clumsy mixture of nostalgia, scares, set pieces, sincerity and wisecracks never gels, tempting a conclusion that it is perhaps time for Sony to give up this particular ghost.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire races onto thin ice overburdened with disparate, uninspired ideas¬† ‚Äì and no one behind or in front of the camera quite knows what to do once the movie‚Äôs flailing in the water.
reviews.author: Tom Jorgensen

reviews.text: Elsewhere original Ghostbusters stars Dan Ackroyd and Ernie Hudson do most of the fan-service heavy lifting... Bill Murray pops up late on with the air of a veteran celebrity going through the motions to pocket an exorbitant appearance fee.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: The film's pacing is slow, and the plot doesn't truly rear its head until the end, which results in a fairly dull experience.
reviews.author: Jon Mendelsohn

reviews.text: Frozen Empire is burdened by too many characters telling bad jokes to be good, but it at least put them all in the New York City firehouse. That‚Äôs where the Ghostbusters, both old and new, belong.
reviews.author: Michael Walsh

reviews.text: While ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù sometimes overdoes it with the 21st-century green-screen stuff, and there are a few lags in the action around the midway point, this is a big and boisterous and just plain fun amusement park ride of a movie.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: One could only make the case that Kenan and Reitman are pivoting from comedy to action if either the action or the comedy played more effectively.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: Too many characters and callbacks plus a formulaic plot means Frozen Empire doesn‚Äôt touch the original movies, but it‚Äôs a likeable-enough brand extension.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: An innocuous, family-friendly supernatural adventure with too many characters and a severe shortage of jokes.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: Everything about the film is undercooked and lazy, and one is led to hope that this franchise is put back in the deep freeze for a very long time.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: There is a noxious undead pong emanating from this latest entry in the 1980s franchise, which is now being necromantically sustained through force of sheer commercial desperation, and nothing else.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: ‚ÄúFrozen Empire‚Äù has enough going on in it to connect, but now that Jason Reitman and company have brought this series back to life, it‚Äôs time to re-infuse it with the spirit that Kumail Nanjiani brings.
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: Poorly paced and incredibly ill-conceived, it‚Äôs utterly baffling that, in this day and age of creative fan fiction, no one could come up with a more inventive, innovative tale than this one chosen.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: Feels like it exists as a studio imperative first ‚Äî ‚ÄúMake a Ghostbusters movie with the cast of the old movies and the cast of the new movie!‚Äù ‚Äî and a compelling story a very distant second.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: It is confusing at times, and not everything works, but Frozen Empire does a very good job of keeping the flame alive, 40 years after the fact.
reviews.author: Damon Wise

reviews.text: Frozen Empire isn‚Äôt terrible, but it‚Äôs also just not as much fun as the previous movie, and because of that, it just might not have the same amount of rewatch value either.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: Simply showing a character, making a somewhat similar joke, or even recreating a scene from the first film isn‚Äôt helping this film in any way. It‚Äôs lazy and only reminds the audience that they‚Äôre not watching that film instead.
reviews.author: Ross Bonaime

reviews.text: This franchise might not be entirely dead just yet, but its latest resurrection doesn‚Äôt make nearly enough good arguments to keep pumping life into it.
reviews.author: Kate Erbland

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire doesn‚Äôt mess with the well-honed formula, carefully balancing its laughs and scares in the breezy manner that makes for pleasurable, if lightweight, viewing.
reviews.author: Frank Scheck

reviews.text: If they keep making bland and unoriginal entries like this, it proves that if you've seen one Ghostbusters, you've seen them all.
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: There was potential here, but Frozen Empire is an overpopulated mish-mash, with too many heroes to wrangle. What‚Äôs left is a bit of a gooey mess. We‚Äôve been slimed.
reviews.author: Alex Godfrey

reviews.text: I ain't afraid of no ghosts - but I am afraid of how this sequel is going to be received by fans. Who ya gonna call? I'm calling the 80's. And parents, this Ghostbusters may NOT be for kids this time.
reviews.author: Christie Cronan

reviews.text: The time has come for Hollywood to allow the spurious Ghostbusters franchise to join Jurassic World and Aquaman in the bin and think of something new.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: They spend way too much time setting up an extended universe that may never happen, and don't focus enough on the characters established by Afterlife.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: While there are aspects of "Frozen Empire" that may remind fans of the expanded¬†spiritual lore that came with "The Real Ghostbusters" animated series, it never coalesces into a solid blockbuster.¬†It's dogs and cats, living together. Mass hysteria.
reviews.author: Ethan Anderton

reviews.text: The widespread criticism of the "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" trailer, that it looked like the filmmakers thought they were creating the next part of a sci-fi saga rather than a comedy one, bears out in the finished product.
reviews.author: Alistair Ryder

reviews.text: If one were to strip away the callbacks to Slimer and the walking Statue of Liberty ‚Äî everything from all the previous films except for the 2016 movie ‚Ä¶ ‚Äî this two-hour movie probably would clock in around 20 minutes.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire has a lot of potential and a chilling new villain, but too many characters and a slower plot leads to dimmed thrills.
reviews.author: Rachel LaBonte

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire takes the training proton packs off and allows the cast to embrace more of an original story this time around, although there are still plenty of nostalgic references abound. Bustin' still makes me feel good.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: 'Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire' is dragged down by its obsession with the past. If the franchise is to continue, its caretakers could learn something from another 'Frozen' and let it go.
reviews.author: Joey Morona

reviews.text: While it is a bit too long, and certainly has its slow moments at the start, this movie is a whole lot of fun with some fantastic visuals. At its core, it is all about family, both blood and chosen.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: An incredibly serviceable instalment, offering up all the hallmarks of the 40-year-old film series... While it‚Äôll hold up as one of the better Legacy Sequels of the era, it does tumble for the usual pitfalls... OG fans will have a great time.
reviews.author: Dave Lee

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is imperfect (though entertaining) evidence that busting still makes me feel good.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: Frozen Empire has some charming performances and moments from McKenna Grace (steals the movie again) and Paul Rudd. But it is a bit overstuffed, even more so than Afterlife. The biggest shame is the wasted use of Bill Murray, yet again.
reviews.author: Lee McCoy

reviews.text: It all resembles a lot of cosplaying, although its central failing is foregrounding cacophonous mayhem and middling melodrama over the drollness that defined the first two Ghostbusters movies.
reviews.author: Nick Schager

reviews.text: I wanted more from Frozen Empire. An Entertaining delight that frustrated me at the same time. As a Ghostbusters fan there is fun to be had but there are multiple issues that hold the film back from the greatness that Afterlife had brought in. A Mixed Bag
reviews.author: Zach Pope

reviews.text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is not the original movie and never would be, but it's an entertainingly spooky blockbuster that proves there's life in this franchise yet.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

synopsis: In Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, the Spengler family returns to where it all started -- the iconic New York City firehouse -- to team up with the original Ghostbusters, who've developed a top-secret research lab to take busting ghosts to the next level. But when the discovery of an ancient artifact unleashes an evil force, Ghostbusters new and old must join forces to protect their home and save the world from a second Ice Age.
